Clairey
1,0 de 5 estrelas Very dull picture quality
Avaliado no Reino Unido em 31 de janeiro de 2022
Compra verificada
UPDATED: Decided to return this item. Very difficult to get the stand off to get it back in its box but got there wirh help of You Tube! Booked before 10am for next day collection - it's now 5pm on the day after collection was due and still bo sign of anyone to collect it and no update provided ☹

I would not recommend this. The picture quality is terrible and I'm really not that fussy! The top half of the screen is a few shades darker than the bottom half and adjusting the brightness/contrast/ sharpness doesn't seem to change things very much at all! I bought this to replace my much loved HP monitor that unfortunately got broken and the same one is no longer available. Wish I chose another HP but the prices have really gone up since last year and I only use it for working from home. It also turned itself off when I was taking a break and it took an age to get it to come back on again. Never had that trouble with the HP. Grrr!!!

GeekChick
4,0 de 5 estrelas Excellent picture quality
Avaliado no Reino Unido em 2 de abril de 2024
Compra verificada
A mídia não pôde ser carregada.
I bought this 21.5-inch Dell Monitor to use alongside my 32-inch 4K monitor. It is set up in portrait mode to work on documents and for reading. The monitor was easy to connect to my dual monitor arm and it is very sturdy. The control panel on the bottom right-hand side of the monitor allows me to adjust the settings to my preference.

The picture quality on this full HD monitor is excellent. However, I am still attempting to find the ideal setting for a more visually comfortable typing and reading experience. What I find strange is that I cannot focus on the screen for too long when the ‘ComfortView’ feature is activated!

While unboxing this monitor, I noticed that the screen’s protective film was missing and there were smudge marks on the monitor; this is not a new product! For this reason, I will have to scrutinise its performance in case of any technical issues. Aside from that, I can recommend this monitor.
10 pessoas acharam isso útil

Christian ROCHER
5,0 de 5 estrelas MONITEUR CLASSIQUE - SANS PROBLEME
Avaliado na França em 26 de novembro de 2023
Compra verificada
Il est probable que bien des moniteurs aient quasiment les mêmes performances, du moins pour les usages classiques de bureautique.
Nous avons choisi celui-ci pour les paramètres suivants :
- Alimentation intégrée, sans bloc externe, ce qui est tout de même plus pratique.
- Mise en route par bouton SOUS l'écran, et non pas à l'arrière comme les Samsung par exemple.
- Garantie de 3 ans, ce qui est souvent le cas, mais pas pour 'tout le monde' : Pour le modèle HP, la garantie était indiquée pour 1 an. Erreur de descriptif (dans ce cas il faut la rectifier), ou réalité (dans ce cas c'est vraiment peu par rapport aux autres marques.
Petit détail négatif de notre point de vue : Le moniteur est articulé dans le sens vertical, mais le logement recevant la partie métallique plate articulée est intégré à la coque plastique. A terme, je doute donc de la solidité, d'autant que l'axe de l'articulation est très serré en usine. Heureusement, une fois installé, on n'y touche plus en principe.
7 pessoas acharam isso útil
Denunciar

Traduzir avaliação para Português
DamianR
5,0 de 5 estrelas Great Quality Budget 22" Monitor
Avaliado no Reino Unido em 22 de junho de 2024
Compra verificada
This is my review of the Dell SE2222H - Not any other monitor gathered here!
I was looking for a smaller monitor for my DAW rig with a VESA mount.
I already had 2 lovely (larger & more expensive!) monitors but I wanted a third monitor on an arm to view plugins whilst playing my main keyboard.
This is a cheap monitor - but great value!
It feels sturdy enough and it does have the standard VESA 100 arrangement - despite what some other reviewers say!
I was able to fix a monitor arm to this very easily - see my photo. It comes with the required screws already installed.
If you don't require the VESA mount, you can blank it off with the included blanking panel.
The picture quality is never going to be as good as a £200+ monitor, but it is pretty good - see my 2nd photo.
Yes, there is some loss when viewed at an angle, but that's what I would expect for a low budget monitor.
This has 1 HDMI and 1 VGA input (why VGA? it's 2024!!).
I used a DVI-D to HDMI adapter to take the third output from my graphics card (DVI-D) to the HDMI input on the monitor.
The monitor was recognised instantly by Win 10 and I was able to arrange it to be the third, rightmost monitor in my rig very easily.
I was able to tweak the colour balance and brightness etc to my liking from the graphics card driver software utility.
Overall this does the job well. It's a low budget monitor with a good name and a nice picture with even illumination.
It doesn't have built in speakers - thank goodness! I never used the built in speakers in monitors - they never sound good.
Recommended if you're on a lower budget and want a quality 22" monitor.
Hope I've helped :-)
DamianR
